feed.title: Wisconsin Autonomous Wiki
feed.subtitle: A student organizaton at the University of Wisconsin - Madison focused on the development of algorithms to be used to control autonomous racing vehicles.

entry.title: Subscribing to Team Calendars
entry.summary: We have an Outlook calendar for each sub-team as well as a general calendar for the entire team. We encourage members to subscribe to the calendars relevant to them in order to keep track of their individual meeting schedule. Here are the subscription links for each calendar: Note: These URL’s are NOT webpages that you can open. You must copy the link use it to subscribe. Guides for how to ...

entry.title: Flashing the Jetson AGX Xavier
entry.summary: This guide outlines how to flash the Jetson AGX Xavier. This is the computer we use on our evGrand Prix vehicle. The Jetson AGX Xavier is built by NVIDIA and runs an operating system called JetPack, which is specific for Jetson computers and is built on top of Linux. “Flashing” the Jetson computer is essentially just reinstalling JetPack. Setup Guide Prerequsites To begin, you must install ...

entry.title: Rules and Safety for Alley Testing

link.title: Rules and Safety for Alley Testing

entry.summary: This is a guide for alley testing with any vehicle (originally written for the evGrand Prix Go-Kart). Driver Safety Driving in alley needs to be approved by autonomous leaders, alley testing is not for driving for the fun of it. Driver Safety Equipment Driver is required to wear: - A motorcycle helmet with proper goggles if it is a dirt bike cycle helmet - Driving gloves - Boots that cover...

entry.title: Reserving a Fleet Vehicle
entry.summary: This is a guide for how to reserve and use a fleet vehicle through UW. Authorize as a Driver To authorize as a driver, see this page. Relevant Information: Supervisor Name: Glenn Bower Supervisor Email: grbower@wisc.edu UDDS code: Ask Glenn Make the reservation To make a reservation, you will need to login to the fleet portable dashboard. entry.title: ROS Overview
entry.summary: This guide outlines how Wisconsin Autonomous structures their ROS respositories and how ROS development should take place Purpose A major difference between Wisconsin Autonomous and industry is that in WA we have much higher turnover. This is because students graduate or move on. In addition, industry has employees working 40hrs a week and WA has students working 5-10hrs a week. As a result, ...
